item.title: Advancing Viscerally Unhuman Technology
item.description: A few days ago, a friend asked the following: I’ve recently been wondering about the politics of unnatural technology. Like, what is the history of normalizing advancements that people find viscerally inhumane? Current technology in this bucket is pro-natal tech, BCI, cultivated meat, etc. Let me know if you have any thoughts or recommendations on what to read. Two books come to mind that have helped me think about this. The first is Theodore Kaczynskiâ€™s Industrial Society and Its Future.
